Transformation","names":{"en":"Type of Transformation"},"description":"Various transformations of the indicators related to the dataset","descriptions":{"en":"Various transformations of the indicators related to the dataset"},"coreRepresentation":{"enumeration":"urn:sdmx:org.sdmx.infomodel.codelist.Codelist=IMF.STA:CL_GFS_TYPE_OF_TRANSFORMATION(1.0+.0)"}},{"annotations":[],"id":"GFS_DF","name":"Domestic / Foreign Creditor or Debtor","names":{"en":"Domestic / Foreign Creditor or Debtor"},"description":"Indicates the residency of the creditor or debtor, distinguishing between domestic residents and foreign residents.","descriptions":{"en":"Indicates the residency of the creditor or debtor, distinguishing between domestic residents and foreign residents."},"coreRepresentation":{"enumeration":"urn:sdmx:org.sdmx.infomodel.codelist.Codelist=IMF.STA:CL_GFS_DF(1.0+.0)"}},{"annotations":[],"id":"GFS_RB","name":"Reporting Valuation Basis","names":{"en":"Reporting Valuation Basis"},"description":"Specifies the valuation basis on which government financial information is reported (e.g., market value, nominal value).","descriptions":{"en":"Specifies the valuation basis on which government financial information is reported (e.g., market value, nominal value)."},"coreRepresentation":{"enumeration":"urn:sdmx:org.sdmx.infomodel.codelist.Codelist=IMF.STA:CL_GFS_RB(1.0+.0)"}},{"annotations":[],"id":"GFS_GRP","name":"GFS Indicator group","names":{"en":"GFS Indicator group"},"description":"Identifies the grouping or classification of Government Finance Statistics indicators (e.g., revenue group, expenditure group, debt indicators, etc.).","descriptions":{"en":"Identifies the grouping or classification of Government Finance Statistics indicators (e.g., revenue group, expenditure group, debt indicators, etc.)."},"coreRepresentation":{"enumeration":"urn:sdmx:org.sdmx.infomodel.codelist.Codelist=IMF.STA:CL_GFS_GRP(1.0+.0)"}},{"annotations":[],"id":"NATURE_OF_DATA","name":"Nature of Data","names":{"en":"Nature of Data"},"description":"Describes the fundamental type or characteristic of the data (e.g., actual, budget, forecast, provisional, revised).","descriptions":{"en":"Describes the fundamental type or characteristic of the data (e.g., actual, budget, forecast, provisional, revised)."},"coreRepresentation":{"format":{"dataType":"String"}}},{"annotations":[],"id":"BASES_OF_RECORDING_CASH_NON_CASH","name":"Basis of reporting – Cash vs Non-Cash","names":{"en":"Basis of reporting – Cash vs Non-Cash"},"description":"Indicates whether the transactions are recorded on a cash basis (when payments are made/received) or an accrual basis (when economic events occur).","descriptions":{"en":"Indicates whether the transactions are recorded on a cash basis (when payments are made/received) or an accrual basis (when economic events occur)."},"coreRepresentation":{"format":{"dataType":"String"}}},{"annotations":[],"id":"BASES_OF_RECORDING_GROSS_NET","name":"Basis of report – Gross or Net","names":{"en":"Basis of report – Gross or Net"},"description":"Specifies whether amounts are reported on a gross basis (full amounts without netting off related items) or a net basis (offsetting related items).","descriptions":{"en":"Specifies whether amounts are reported on a gross basis (full amounts without netting off related items) or a net basis (offsetting related items)."},"coreRepresentation":{"format":{"dataType":"String"}}},{"annotations":[],"id":"VALUATION","name":"Valuation","names":{"en":"Valuation"},"description":"Valuation refers to the rules and conventions used for recording monetary flows and stocks in macroeconomic statistics. Standard national accounts valuations include the basic price (what the seller receives) and the purchaser's price (what the purchaser pays). The purchaser's price is the basic price, plus taxes less subsidies on products, plus invoiced transportation and insurance services, plus distribution margin. International trade in goods considers the free on board (fob) price and cost-insurance-freight price, among others. Other valuation types include prices used in financial markets (e.g., buy and sell prices).","descriptions":{"en":"Valuation refers to the rules and conventions used for recording monetary flows and stocks in macroeconomic statistics. Standard national accounts valuations include the basic price (what the seller receives) and the purchaser's price (what the purchaser pays). The purchaser's price is the basic price, plus taxes less subsidies on products, plus invoiced transportation and insurance services, plus distribution margin. International trade in goods considers the free on board (fob) price and cost-insurance-freight price, among others. Other valuation types include prices used in financial markets (e.g., buy and sell prices)."},"coreRepresentation":{"enumeration":"urn:sdmx:org.sdmx.infomodel.codelist.Codelist=IMF.STA:CL_GFS_VALUATION(2.0+.0)"}},{"annotations":[],"id":"GFS_COMPONENT","name":"GFS Standard Presentation Component","names":{"en":"GFS Standard Presentation Component"},"description":"A variable defines series between standard and memorandum items.","descriptions":{"en":"A variable defines series between standard and memorandum items."},"coreRepresentation":{"enumeration":"urn:sdmx:org.sdmx.infomodel.codelist.Codelist=IMF.STA:CL_GFS_STANDARD_PRESENTATION_COMPONENT(1.0+.0)"}}],"isPartial":false}]},"meta":{"schema":"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/sdmx-twg/sdmx-json/master/metadata-message/tools/schemas/2.0.0/sdmx-json-metadata-schema.json","id":"IDREF2764","test":false,"prepared":"2025-11-09T20:52:36.015433624Z","contentLanguages":["en"],"sender":{"id":"unknown"}}}
